summary: This is an email chain from March 2008 discussing concerns that Jeffrey Epstein's investigators are harassing victims and their parents. The emails propose contacting the police and coordinating with the DOJ Victim-Witness coordinator, while also questioning whether Epstein's legal team in Washington, D.C., can be asked to stop these aggressive tactics.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; his investigators are accused of harassing victims and their parents, and using the state criminal case to subpoena depositions.

events.title: Harassment of victim's parents by Epstein's investigators
events.description: Epstein's investigators reportedly visited the parents of a victim, demanded to see the victim, and claimed to have a video of her that they threatened to put on the internet.

events.title: DOJ Victim-Witness coordinator to contact victims
events.description: Planned for the DOJ Victim-Witness coordinator to call all victims on Monday to offer pro bono lawyer services and advise about contacting police.

keyFacts: Epstein's investigators allegedly harassed the parents of a victim, demanding to see the victim and threatening to release a purported video of her on the internet.
The email sender does not believe Epstein actually has such videos but notes the investigators' tactics are becoming 'more aggressive.'
Epstein is reportedly using the state criminal case to subpoena depositions of victims in the federal case to gather information about the 'invention' (likely investigation).
There is a coordination effort involving the DOJ Victim-Witness coordinator to offer victims pro bono legal services and advice on contacting police.
The emails suggest a tension between ongoing settlement discussions in Washington, D.C., and these aggressive investigative tactics.
